Modular Cargo Solutions presents to you:

The MODULAR CARGO TRANSPORT SYSTEM

In the works is a module-based cargo spacecraft heavily based off of JAXA's HTV (This). Essential to every spacecraft will be a propulsion module and docking module, at the front and back of the craft. In between them, however, its all up to you!

You can pick from various modules, including:

The Unpressurized Cargo Module (UCM), perfect for awkward payloads or small satellites:

The Pressurized Cargo Module (PCM), for storing Orbital Construction parts or any other non-liquid cargo:

The Liquid Cargo Module (LCM), a tank for monopropellant, liquid fuel, oxidizer, or Kethane:

The Flight Avionics Module (FAM), without which you shouldnt leave the spaceport, has slots for optional Mechjeb or ORDA computers, and built in reaction wheels:

By picking and choosing modules as if they were meats and cheeses, you end up with a veritable spacecraft sandwich!

Modular Transportation System (MTS).dae (click to view in 3D)

Anyway, as you can see, these models are rough, untextured, and still on Sketchup. I am very much the eager amateur, and as I cannot get my head around Blender or Unity for my life, I'd really appreciate both constructive criticism and suggestions on expansion, but more importantly, a partner with knowledge of giving these models some color and bringing them into KSP to help this project come to fruition.

Edited August 13, 2013 by Budgie
